text:
Summary



BHEL gets Rs 672 crore order from Indian Railways.Larsen & Toubro gets Delhi Expo Centre phase-I contract for Rs 2,790 crore.Thyssenkrupp to have 50 percent stake in Tata Steel joint venture for six years.GVK Power unit wins bid for 17,06,300 tonnes coal.SEBI revokes shell company status on Prakash Industries.






Indian equity benchmarks rose to record highs on Friday led by technology heavyweights such as Tata Consultancy Services and Infosys.This morning, Japan’s stocks opened flat after reaching the highest in more than a quarter century Monday, while the euro rebounded from a brief slump during holiday-thinned trading.The Singapore-traded SGX Nifty, an early indicator of NSE Nifty 50 Index’s performance in India was a little changed at 10,532 as of 6:50 a.m.





FPIs’ net outflow from equities at Rs 7,300 crore in December so far.https://t.co/Fg3nDMt6ZC pic.twitter.com/FUq6Ejbnw2— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) December 25, 2017
title: Stocks To Watch: GVK Power, Religare Enterprises, L&T;, Tata Steel
